hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Matar from al-Hasan that he said: If he becomes wealthy in his fasting before he completes it, he must offer a penalty. He was asked about a man who performed Umrah in the months of Hajj then returned to his city, is there an obligation (of hady) upon him? From Qatadah from Said ibn al-Musayyab that he said: There is nothing upon him except if he performs Hajj in that same year. He said: The companions of the Messenger of Allah used to perform Umrah in the months of Hajj then return and they do not offer (hady). From Yahya ibn Said from Said ibn al-Musayyab in similar fashion.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Abu Maashar from al-Nakhae'i that Ali said: Two circumambulations and two ritual walkings. From Ayoub from Nafi' that Ibn Umar did not perform Tamattu' except in one year. He was told: We fear that there will be fighting. He said: And fighting! Then I will do what the Messenger of Allah did. He said: For you indeed in the Messenger of Allah is the best example (Quran 33:21). He said: So he made talbiyyah for Umrah, then traveled a little, then said: Why would Umrah and Hajj be the same way? So he made talbiyyah for Hajj, and he made one circumambulation and one ritual walking.
